epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.functional_properties: General use concrete (Including: Footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete)
product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.candidate_list_substances: None present above 0.1% of product weight
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options, modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
The Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
impact_categories_calculated_manually: Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
lca_information.allocation: Intermediate flows allocated physically based on weight (quarries) or based on m3 of concrete (batching plant). Economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible. Fly ash and silica fumes are waste products and burden-free. Ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed in production are not accounted for. Personnel-related impacts are excluded. No energy or mass flows, except packaging of materials, were excluded.
lca_information.data_quality: All data sources were scored good or very good. Background data sources updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14.
lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate (A1-A3) with options, modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D. Life cycle stages B1-B7 not declared.
lca_information.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity from primary and secondary energy resources.
lca_information.core_processes: External transportation of materials, internal transport, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater.
lca_information.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage of construction products, transport and use of materials for deconstruction, transport and treatment of waste at end of life.
lca_information.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete.

deconstruction.process: Physical process of drilling and removing the concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 80% of product is reprocessed/recycled as Module C3, remaining undergoes inert waste landfill as Module C4.

carbon_emission_context.context: The building environment accounts for 39% of global CO2 emissions, with construction materials comprising 11%. By 2030, embodied carbon of all construction materials needs to be at least 40% lower. By 2050, all new construction materials need to be net zero (World Green Building Council).

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from the atmosphere through carbonation, which can offset some of the CO2 emitted during cement manufacturing.
carbonation.consideration_in_epd: CO2 absorption by carbonation has not been considered in this EPD and is not reflected in the results tables.

energy_source_in_electricity_mix.mix: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)
Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)
Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)
Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)
Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: Co-products are considered as co-products of their production process and impacts are allocated according to PCR 2019:14. Fly ash and silica fume are treated as waste materials (only transport impacts included). Ground granulated blast furnace slag is allocated based on economic value.
recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used to model co-products. AusLCI process for fly ash and slag, ecoinvent process for silica fume.
recycled_materials_handling.recycling_and_recovery_rate: 80% (based on National Waste Report rate, DCCEEW, 2023)
recycled_materials_handling.end_of_life_recycling: Waste concrete is processed into recycled aggregate, which can replace virgin coarse aggregate.
